title: SalivaDirect™: RNA extraction-free SARS-CoV-2 diagnostics

creator.name: Nathan Grubaugh
creator.affiliation: Department of Epidemiology of Microbial Diseases, Yale School of Public Health

source.description: Saliva should be collected with the assistance of a healthcare worker or technician.
Before collection, clean hands using alcohol-based sanitizer or soap and water (no fragrances) and don appropriate PPE (at minimum, gloves and a mask).
Ensure all collection materials are labelled with the correct identifying information.

While preparing collection materials, direct the sample provider to begin pooling saliva in their mouth. Saliva production can be stimulated by thinking about food (favorite foods, upcoming meals, etc.) or about the saliva collection itself.

source.body:
This protocol is intended for the collection of the normal saliva that naturally pools into the mouth. No coughing or sniffing prior to sample collection is required.
Ideally, water should be avoided 10 minutes prior to collection. Other drinks, food, and nasal sprays should be avoided for half an hour before sample collection.

source.description: Remove the lid of the collection container, and direct the sample provider to gently expel saliva into the container until at least 0.5 mL has been collected.

source.body: The total volume measured is to exclude any bubbles.

source.description: Once at least 0.5 mL has been collected, securely replace the lid of the collection container.
Sterilize the container surface with 70% ethanol or a disinfecting wipe, and place the sample in a secondary container or an appropriately labeled biohazard bag.
Dispose of gloves, and register the sample collection (including date and time).

Samples can either be treated with either:
  • Workflow 1: Standard SalivaDirect protocol
  • Workflow 2: Pre-Treatment Heat step prior to SalivaDirect protocol without the addition of Proteinase K and heat inactivation step
  • Workflow 3: Pre-Treatment Heat step prior to standard SalivaDirect protocol with Proteinase K and heat inactivation step
Select the appropriate option below.

cases.title: Workflow 1: Standard SalivaDirect protocol
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5q1iu","text":"Standard SalivaDirect protocol with Proteinase K and heat inactivation step","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":75,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Workflow 2: Heat pre-treatment only
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1hrcc","text":"Pre-Treatment Heat step prior to SalivaDirect protocol without the addition of Proteinase K and heat inactivation step","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":118,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Workflow 3: Heat pre-treatment then proteinase K

source.description: Prepare 20 uM working stocks of the primers and probes (sequences provided in Materials) by adding 20 µL of 100 uM stock to 80 µL nuclease-free water.

source.body:
Briefly vortex and centrifuge reagents before use.
Probes are photosensitive and should be stored in the dark.

source.description:
Use the 20 uM working stocks to prepare dualplex primer-probe-water mix containing the following:
ABC
1ComponentVolume (1 reaction) Volume (100 reactions)
22019-nCoV_N1-F (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
32019-nCoV_N1-R (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
42019-nCoV_N1-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
5RP-F (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
6RP-R (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
7RP-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
8Nuclease-free water2.5 µL250 µL

ABC
1ComponentVolume (1 reaction) Volume (100 reactions)
22019-nCoV_N1-F (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
32019-nCoV_N1-R (400 nM/reaction)0.4 µL40 µL
42019-nCoV_N1-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
5RP-F (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
6RP-R (150 nM/reaction)0.15 µL15 µL
7RP-P (200 nM/reaction)0.2 µL20 µL
8Nuclease-free water2.5 µL250 µL

Prepare a master mix from one of the approved vendors containing the following (account for 10% extra lost during pipetting), excluding
processed saliva
samples or control
Component NEB Luna (2x) Bio-Rad Reliance Thermo TaqPath
Master mix 10 µL 5 µL 5 µL
RT 1 µL - -
Primer-probe- water mix (see Step 11.1) 4 µL 4 µL 4 µL
Nuclease-free water - 6 µL 6 µL
Treated sample or control 5 µL (do not add to master mix) 5 µL (do not add to master mix) 5 µL (do not add to master mix)

Component NEB Luna (2x) Bio-Rad Reliance Thermo TaqPath
Master mix 10 µL 5 µL 5 µL
RT 1 µL - -
Primer-probe- water mix (see Step 11.1) 4 µL 4 µL 4 µL
Nuclease-free water - 6 µL 6 µL
Treated sample or control 5 µL (do not add to master mix) 5 µL (do not add to master mix) 5 µL (do not add to master mix)

Load the plate into the qPCR machine, and run the following thermocycler conditions on standard mode:
ABC
1StepTemperatureTime
2152°C10 min
3295°C 2 min
4395°C 10 sec
5455°C 30 sec
65Read plate (FAM & Cy5 channels)
7Repeat steps 3-5 for 44 cycles.

ABC
1StepTemperatureTime
2152°C10 min
3295°C 2 min
4395°C 10 sec
5455°C 30 sec
65Read plate (FAM & Cy5 channels)
7Repeat steps 3-5 for 44 cycles.

source.body: For the ABI 7500 Fast Dx the threshold should be manually set to 100,000 for N1 and to 10,000 for RP. For other PCR instruments this will be automatically determined.

source.description: Transfer the sample to the laboratory for sample processing. If the time between sample collection and the initial processing steps (aliquoting) is likely to exceed 6 hours, samples can be stored at 2-8°C for up to 7 days, or -80°C for long-term storage, then later thawed on ice for testing.

Add Proteinase K (see table for volume per sample) to designated 8-strip PCR tubes (200 µL capacity).
ABC
1VendorConcentrationVolume
2ThermoFisher Scientific MagMAX™ Viral/Pathogen Proteinase K50 mg/mL2.5 µL
3New England Biolabs Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade20 mg/mL6.25 µL
4AmericanBio Proteinase KLyophilized (add 50 mg per 1 mL of nuclease-free water) 2.5 µL

ABC
1VendorConcentrationVolume
2ThermoFisher Scientific MagMAX™ Viral/Pathogen Proteinase K50 mg/mL2.5 µL
3New England Biolabs Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade20 mg/mL6.25 µL
4AmericanBio Proteinase KLyophilized (add 50 mg per 1 mL of nuclease-free water) 2.5 µL

source.body: This work should be completed under BSL-2 conditions, and samples potentially containing SARS-CoV-2 should only be handled in a biosafety cabinet. Please seek guidance from your local biosafety office on specific recommendations for working with samples which could contain SARS-CoV-2.

source.description: Vortex each saliva sample until homogeneous, and immediately transfer 50 µL saliva to each 8-strip PCR tube containing proteinase K. Add 50 µL of nuclease-free water to one 8-strip PCR tube (negative extraction control).
Close the 8-strip tube lids tightly.
Place the 8-strip tubes in a rack and vortex for 1 minute at 3000-5000 RPM.
Briefly spin down the rack/tubes using a plate spinner or 8-strip tube microcentrifuge.

source.body: If no plate centrifuge or spinner is available, the plate can be gently tapped to get the samples at the bottom of each well.

source.description: Inactivate the proteinase K by heating samples for 5 minutes at 95°C on a PCR instrument or equivalent thermocycler.
Briefly spin down the tubes using a plate spinner or 8-strip tube microcentrifuge.

source.body: Tubes should only be centrifuged for a few seconds, to spin down condensation in the tubes.

source.description: Store samples at -80°C or proceed immediately to RT-qPCR testing.
Incubate saliva samples in a thermocycler, water bath, oven or similar at 65°C for 15 minutes, 95°C for 5 minutes OR 95°C for 30 minutes.

source.body: If incubating saliva samples at 95°C be sure to use tubes and labels that are stable (i.e. do not burn or melt) at this high temperature.

source.description: Vortex samples then proceed immediately to RT-qPCR testing.
Select the appropriate option below if you are using 96 well plates or 384 well plates.
Add 5 µL of processed saliva sample (including the processed negative extraction control) to each designated well. Mix by pipetting (avoid bubbles).

source.body: Extraction-free saliva samples can be added using a multichannel pipette for high-throughput testing.

source.description:
Add 5 µL of positive control (
Twist synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA controls
at 100 copies/uL) and no-template control (NTC - water) to designated PCR wells for the controls (1 NTC, and 2 positive controls per plate). Mix by pipetting, taking care to avoid introducing bubbles.
Seal with a transparent plastic qPCR seal. Centrifuge briefly to remove bubbles, if present.
Place the 96-well PCR plate on the PCR cooler and add 15 µL of mastermix to each designated well.

For the Agilent AriaMX: After loading the plate in the thermocycler, place a compression pad securely on the top of the plate and assure the position is aligned with the plate. On the AriaMX screen select “graphical displays” and then adjust or confirm that the Cycle Range for Background Based Threshold is: “8 thru 12”.

On ice, prepare a master mix from one of the approved vendors containing the following (account for 10% extra lost during pipetting), excluding processed saliva or controls:
Component NEB Luna (2x) NEB Luna 4X Bio-Rad Reliance Thermo TaqPath
Master mix 5 µL 2.5 µL 2.5 µL 2.5 µL
RT 0.5 µL - - -
Primer-probe-water mix (see Step 11.1) 2 µL 2 µL 2 µL 2 µL
Nuclease-free water - 3 µL 3 µL 3 µL
Treated sample or control 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix) 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix) 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix) 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix)

Component NEB Luna (2x) NEB Luna 4X Bio-Rad Reliance Thermo TaqPath
Master mix 5 µL 2.5 µL 2.5 µL 2.5 µL
RT 0.5 µL - - -
Primer-probe-water mix (see Step 11.1) 2 µL 2 µL 2 µL 2 µL
Nuclease-free water - 3 µL 3 µL 3 µL
Treated sample or control 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix) 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix) 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix) 2.5 µL (do not add to master mix)
Place the 384-well PCR plate on the PCR cooler and add 7.5 µL of mastermix to each designated well.

Add 2.5 µL of processed saliva sample (including the processed negative extraction control) to each designated well. Mix by pipetting (avoid bubbles).
NOTE: processed saliva samples can be added using a multichannel for high-throughput testing

Add 2.5 µL of positive control (e.g. Twist synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA controls (100 copies/µL)) and no-template control (NTC - water) to the designated PCR tubes (on ice). Mix by pipetting (avoid bubbles).
Seal with a transparent plastic PCR seal. Briefly centrifuge for a few seconds to remove bubbles, if present.

Load the plate into the qPCR machine, and run the following thermocycler conditions on standard mode:
ABC
1StepTemperatureTime
2152°C10 min
3295°C 2 min
4395°C 10 sec
5455°C 30 sec
65Read plate (FAM & Cy5 channels)
7Repeat steps 3-5 for 44 cycles.

ABC
1StepTemperatureTime
2152°C10 min
3295°C 2 min
4395°C 10 sec
5455°C 30 sec
65Read plate (FAM & Cy5 channels)
7Repeat steps 3-5 for 44 cycles.

Results will be interpreted according to the table below:
For: CFX384 Touch, ABI QuantStudio 5, ABI QuantStudio 6, ABI QuantStudio 7 Pro, ABI QuantStudio 7 Flex, ABI QuantStudio 12K Flex
Result Ct value N1 Ct value RP
Positive <40.0 Any value
Negative ≥40.0 <35.0
*Invalid ≥40.0 ≥35.0

Result Ct value N1 Ct value RP
Positive <40.0 Any value
Negative ≥40.0 <35.0
*Invalid ≥40.0 ≥35.0

source.body: A larger volume of primer-probe-water mix can be prepared in advance, aliquoted in LightSafe microcentrifuge tubes, and stored at -20°C.

processed saliva
samples or control

Place the 96-well PCR plate on the PCR cooler and add 15 µL of mastermix to each designated well.

When testing saliva samples immediately in RT-PCR following the pre-treatment heat step (no addition of proteinase K), vortex samples vigorously prior to addition to the PCR plate to ensure samples are homogenous.

source.body: After vortexing, samples can be briefly centrifuged for a few seconds prior to opening to draw down any droplets that may have formed.

source.description: Add 5 µL of processed saliva sample (including the processed negative extraction control) to each designated well. Mix by pipetting (avoid bubbles).

source.description:
Report results per the following criteria:
For Bio-Rad CFX96 Touch, ABI 7500 Fast, ABI 7500 Fast Dx and ABI QuantStudio 5
Result Ct value N1 Ct value RP
Positive <40.0 Any value
Negative ≥40.0 <35.0
*Invalid ≥40.0 ≥35.0
For ABI QuantStudio 6 and ABI Quant Studio 7 Pro
Result Ct value N1 Ct value RP
Positive <37.0 Any value
Negative ≥37.0 <35.0
*Invalid ≥37.0 ≥35.0
For Agilent AriaMX

Bring the processed samples and the PCR mastermix plate to a biosafety cabinet.

source.body: Most institutions will require samples potentially containing full-length SARS-CoV-2 RNA to be handled in a biosafety cabinet. Please seek guidance from your local biosafety office on specific recommendations for working with samples which could contain full-length SARS-CoV-2 RNA.

source.description: Bring the processed samples and the PCR mastermix plate to a biosafety cabinet.

Place the 384-well PCR plate on the PCR cooler and add 7.5 µL of mastermix to each designated well.
Add 2.5 µL of processed saliva sample (including the processed negative extraction control) to each designated well. Mix by pipetting (avoid bubbles).

source.body: Processed saliva samples can be added using a multichannel for high-throughput testing.

source.description: Add 2.5 µL of positive control (e.g. Twist synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA controls (100 copies/µL)) and no-template control (NTC - water) to the designated PCR tubes (on ice). Mix by pipetting (avoid bubbles).
Seal with a transparent plastic PCR seal. Briefly centrifuge for a few seconds to remove bubbles, if present.

Load the plate into the qPCR machine, and run the following thermocycler conditions on standard mode:

When testing saliva samples immediately in RT-PCR following the pre-treatment heat step (no addition of proteinase K), vortex samples vigorously prior to addition to the PCR plate to ensure samples are homogenous.

source.body: After vortexing, samples can be briefly centrifuged for a few seconds prior to opening to draw down any droplets that may have formed.

description:
SalivaDirect™ is an RNA-extraction free, dual-plexed RT-qPCR method for SARS-CoV-2 detection. It can be broadly implemented as it (1) does not require saliva collection tubes containing preservatives, (2) does not require specialized equipment for RNA extraction, and (3) is validated for use with products from multiple vendors. Thus, the simplicity and flexibility of SalivaDirect™ means that it is not as affected by supply chain bottlenecks as some other assays. Our method is RNA-extraction free which enables testing of low volume and minimally processed saliva in dual-plexed RT-qPCR for SARS-CoV-2 detection. Saliva will be treated with proteinase K followed by a heat inactivation step, and is then directly used as input in the dual-plexed RT-qPCR test. Our aim was not to design new primers and probes for RT-qPCR testing, but rather to use validated primer and probe sets (N1 and RP) developed by the US CDC. The human Ribonuclease P (RP) probe was modified with a different fluorophore so that the primer/probe set could be combined in a dualplex assay, reducing the number of tests to 1 assay with 2 sets.
Version 2 includes:
  • Optimized thermocycler conditions
  • Locally validated alternative options for Proteinase K, RT-qPCR master mix, and thermocyclers
  • Use of 8-strip tubes for sample processing step, due to contamination issues in 96-well plates.
  • Version 3 has been updated to remove steps for sample self-collection.
  • Version 4 has updated Ct thresholds for the ABI 7500 Fast Dx.
  • Version 5 has an updated description for use, additional RP probe with ATTO647 fluorophore, and a detailed table with catalog numbers.
  • Version 6 includes:
  • Introducing multiple workflows for sample processing including heat Pre-treatment as an alternative to Proteinase K
  • Updated list of RT-qPCR reagents, theromcyclers and protocol for 384 well format.
Version 3 has been updated to remove steps for sample self-collection.
Version 4 has updated Ct thresholds for the ABI 7500 Fast Dx.
Version 5 has an updated description for use, additional RP probe with ATTO647 fluorophore, and a detailed table with catalog numbers.
Version 6 includes:
  • Introducing multiple workflows for sample processing including heat Pre-treatment as an alternative to Proteinase K
  • Updated list of RT-qPCR reagents, theromcyclers and protocol for 384 well format.
